aboutBlock.title: What you need to know, before you ask.

featuredSessions.description: Kotlin/Everywhere is a global series of community-led events, where developers can learn the essentials and best practices in Android, Google Cloud Platform, and multi-platform development
featuredSessions.label: Explore featured session

howItWas.description: Described by many as 'Google I/O of Ukraine', our team creates DevFest to be the best place for experience sharing in a phenomenal atmosphere.
howItWas.label: See how it was in 2016

team.description:
Google is known all around the world. Everyone is 'googling', checking on 'maps' and communicating in 'gmail'. For simple users, they are services that just works, but not for us. Developers see much more: APIs, scalability issues, complex technology stacks. And that is what GDG is about.

[GDG Nizhny Novgorod](https://www.meetup.com/Google-Developer-Group-Nizhny-Novgorod) is open and volunteer geek community who create exciting projects and share experience about Google technologies with a passion.

Kotlin is a modern and statically typed programming language targeting the JVM, Android, JavaScript & Native that will boost your productivity and increase your developer happiness which is sponsored and developed by JetBrains. If your interest about Kotlin started to grow - then join to your local KUG and become involved!

[Kotlin Nizhny Novgorod User Group](https://www.meetup.com/kotlin_nn) is open community and a place to share experience between Kotlin programmers and to get newcomers excited about the language

Our common goal is to organize space to connect best industry experts with Russian audience to boost the development of IT.

notifications.enabled: We will miss you but you can unsubscribe anytime
notifications.blocked: We can't send you notifications right now. Please enable notifications in your browser

blocks.title: Organizers
blocks.description: GDG Nizhny Novgorod and Kotlin Nizhny Novgorod User Group, non-profit organisations created in 2015 and 2019. This conference is community based and is 100% run by volunteers.

blocks.title: What is GDG?
blocks.description: Google Developers Groups (GDGs) are communities of volunteers who create exciting projects and share experiences about Google technologies.

blocks.title: What is DevFest?
blocks.description: DevFests are community-led developer events hosted by Google Developer Groups around the globe.

blocks.title: What is KUG?
blocks.description: KUG stands for Kotlin User Group and is an open community and a place to share experience between Kotlin programmers and to get newcomers excited about the language
